stand_out:
1. (Step 1) Identify additional design improvements for your new Azure server farm.
2. (Step 2) Assess whether Contoso would be better off with an SQL Managed Instance, and note Azure Pricing differences.
3. (Step 3) Build and set up a point-to-point (site to site) VPN connection between Contoso’s on-premises and Contoso’s Azure environments.
4. (Step 4) Visit the [Azure Templates on GitHub](https://github.com/azure/azure-quickstart-templates) and look at all available templates. Can you find a template that deploys 2 web servers, a load balancer, and a Resource Group? Send the link to the template or a screenshot clearly highlighting the one you will select, and discuss the benefits of using such a template.
5. (Step 5) Create more than one backup policy for each type of data. For example, you may want to create a policy that backs up certain files and folders and not the entire VM’s hard drive. Try a policy that has folder exclusion and inclusion.

rubric_items.passed_description: (Step 1) Includes a list of all current on-premises servers and services. Make sure to list any relevant backups or antivirus for each server.
(Step 1) Matches the list of on-premises servers and services to reasonable corresponding Azure ones.
rubric_items.criteria: Investigate equivalent Azure solutions to the on-premises environment.

rubric_items.passed_description:
(Step 1) Answers the two discussion questions for Step 1, regarding:
- inventorying services running on on-premises devices
- where any firewall exceptions can be found
rubric_items.criteria: Inventory relevant services and firewall exceptions to carry to the cloud.

rubric_items.passed_description: (Step 2) Includes a table providing your current server farm and its corresponding Azure farm. Lists the potential Azure replacement for each of the on-premises servers, the VM type and monthly cost.
rubric_items.criteria: Analyze cost estimates of the cloud migration.

rubric_items.passed_description: (Step 2) Discusses any single points of failure or redundancy concerns with their current Azure plan. For example, what happens to availability if a server needs an upgrade?
rubric_items.criteria: Assess the possibility of high availability / disaster recovery in the cloud.

rubric_items.passed_description:
(Step 2) Discusses whether or VM type / size can be changed after deployment.

Includes a screenshot of the VM Overview settings, including at least the VM name and size.
(Step 4) Creates a replica of the WordPress server configuration, and includes a screenshot of the template configuration process.
rubric_items.criteria: Create a replica of the WordPress server configuration.

rubric_items.passed_description: (Step 4) Lists at least three benefits of using ARM templates. Think of when, why and how you can benefit from this Azure service.
rubric_items.criteria: Perform a cost/benefit analysis of using ARM templates.

rubric_items.passed_description: (Step 4) Distinguishes between the ARM template and a server image, both in what they are and when they are used.
rubric_items.criteria: Compare and contrast ARM templates with server images.

rubric_items.passed_description: (Step 5) Backs up all VMs, and provides a screenshot of the 1) backup vault and 2) the backup policy. The name of the backup vault should be present.
(Step 5) Discusses the difference between Azure backup and site recovery, including when would you use each service and for what reason.
rubric_items.criteria: Compare and contrast Azure Backup and Azure Site Recovery.

rubric_items.passed_description: (Step 5) Discusses the differences between Restore Time Objective (RTO) and Restore Point Objective (RPO).
rubric_items.criteria: Compare and contrast Restore Time Objective (RTO) and Restore Point Objective (RPO).

rubric_items.passed_description:
(Step 6) Each Network Security Group (NSG) is adjusted to allow for traffic from the relevant antivirus server.

Provides a screenshot of the modified NSG firewall inbound rules confirming that relevant ports/IP are open to traffic.
rubric_items.criteria: Adjust Network Security Groups to allow for traffic from the antivirus server.

rubric_items.passed_description: (Step 6) Discusses whether they need to create an inbound port exception on a Windows OS.
rubric_items.criteria: Analyze the need for an inbound port exception on Windows OS.

project.name: Moving from On-Prem to the Azure Cloud
